dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
Sooo... I guess this is it. It was good knowing you!
*Grabs communication radio and frantically tries to attune it to Base's frequency*
Oh to hell with this, I can't believe those bastards just cut off all of the comms.

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Now, now, let's not waste the last bit of oxygen throwing tantrums...
And if I could decide where to die, this isn't a bad place.

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: I feel like this might be a perfectly good time to be upset, not that the company lapdog would get it...

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: Company lapdog- you...

decisions.text: There are worse places, worse ways to die truly...
Is now truly the time for pointless arguments? Our oxygen levels are dropping by the second.

dialogs.speaker: Unknown
dialogs.text:
*Comms Radio Beeps...*
*Static noise...* Hello?
Can you hear me?
This is Handler 03, codename Lilly from the Mars colony program Shadow Garden...

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text:
We've receive a distress signal from this frequency.
Is someone there?
I Repeat...
We've receive a distress signal from this frequency.
Is someone there? Do you copy?

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
Yes, loud and clear. This is Flight mission Dies Irae, fleet 021. Navigator Celeste talking.
We're running low on oxygen and our active time is diminishing quickly. Send possible coordinates for a clear landing. Over.

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text:
Roger that...
Sector X-24Y-67Z-12
[UNABLE TO LAND]
Sector X-30Y-29Z-04
[UNABLE TO LAND]
Sector X-95Y-53Z-04
[CLEAR TO LAND]
Go Ahead, you are clear to land.

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
Commander 'Player Name' speaking... Landing processes initiated. Landing in 5 minutes regular time. Fleet 021 out.
*Landing Finalized*
*Please put on your suits*
*Opening decompression chamber*
*Airlock one through 3 disengaging*
*Clear to walk*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
What the... How is this even possible, they completely recreated a society... in MARS?
*Mutters* Independence from base uh? Maybe we could get the things needed to make it back to Earth.

dialogs.speaker: Unknown2
dialogs.text: Hello, I'm Carnation Commanding Captain of the Shadow Garden colony.

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text:
You must be the Commander, a pleasure to meet you. Would you mind following me back to the colony?
I haven't used one of these suits in a long time, it's hard to move after a while.
*You follow him back to the colony*
*A small girl approaches you*

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text: It's a pleasure you must be 'Player Name', the girl is Celeste... And you are?

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: I'm Chief engineer Izumi it's a pleasure. Could you perhaps show me the mechanical bay? There's something I would like to check.

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: Sorry for the Nutjob, sometimes he forgets his manners.

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: No problem at all, we haven't gotten any visitor lately. The temporary reports and visiting fleets all died down, so Lilly is also excited. Let me show you around so you meet with the others residents.

decisions.text: Follow Izumi and Lilly to the Mechanical Bay...

decisions.speaker: Player
decisions.text: Follow Celeste and Carnation to greet the other residents...

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
*You trail behind of Izumi, paying close attention to the conversation* I want to fix the Spaceship, if we are able to get back home...
We could help you restore contact to base and maybe get you out of here.

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text:
I don't imagine living my life in Earth anymore...
After they stopped contacting us temporarily, we persevered and really built something we could call home. But I'm more than happy to help you.

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: Thanks a lot... I don't know what would've happened to us without your help.

decisions.text: *Stay quiet*
Why did base stop all contact and periodical voyages? It's not like them to abandon people.

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text:
You see...
Captain was a bit enthusiastic about the whole project. When we were told to abandon the colony, and return to base...
Captain refused and stayed behind, of course a couple of us chose to stay as well. After that, we never got any feedback on our reports and the people who once left never returned.

decisions.speaker: Player
decisions.text: Should've follow the orders...

decisions.speaker: Player
decisions.text: The base is really cruel sometimes...

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text: What would you know.

dialogs.speaker: Lilly
dialogs.text: We are here!

dialogs.speaker: Unknown
dialogs.text:
*Mockingly says* Hey, I haven´t seen you around...
Did you crash land in here!? I'm Ivy the head mechanic, It's your pleasure to meet me.

dialogs.speaker: Ivy
dialogs.text: I hear you want to fix your Spaceship...

decisions.text: *Stick with them and help Izumi repair the Spaceship*
*Go see what Celeste is doing*

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
*You find yourself in Izumi's company* I can't believe how fast you can repair this thing...If we just could find what is causing the propulsors to fail, we could leave.
*Mutters* And go back to our families
*Izumi is checking the logs*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Commander...
This can´t be...
Why didn't you tell us.
*The once censured Mission Protocol*
Contact Shadow Garden and disable the magnetic field [High Risk]

decisions.text: *Stay silent*
Never would've thought that we would find a ghost's nest...

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text: Base seems to think this magnetic field the Captain defends with his whole heart, could be the cause to the deviation of the asteroids to Earth.

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
That's it then... we found the cause.The propulsors keep failing because of the force impeding the take off...
And if we could just finish this mission we would not get terminated, and possibly even get promoted...
You know I had a feeling we would get kicked out of space program, but they had no cause...
So they send us in a mission that other 20 fleets couldn't finish.
And if we got back without any work done...
Well you know what happens after.

decisions.text: Well seems like there's a promotion for us to get!
You don't seem to grasp the consequences... *Go check Celeste*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Ivy told me a little about how the magnetic field works.
And I know where the power supply and probably the console is... but I can't do it unnoticed unless you create some kind of distraction.
I only need 5 minutes.
*Izumi briefs you on how to proceed*
*You join the others at the canteen*

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
Finally, took you long enough.
Where is the asshole? Did he get lost in the "marvellous wonder of mechanical engineering"?

decisions.text: He's finishing up with the Spaceship
I don't... *Go check on Izumi*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: Commander do you copy?

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
Yes, over.
*Izumi starts a countdown*

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
Yes, over.
*Izumi starts a countdown*

decisions.text: Spill tea on Celeste
Shut the canteen light off
Kick the random child

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Let's make a break for it!
We might have less time than I thought...
Ivy saw me in the console room.
*You and Izumi start running to the Spaceship*
*The colony members as well as Celeste get confused*
*Ivy shouts from afar*

dialogs.speaker: Ivy
dialogs.text:
Captain stop these fiends, they turned off the magnetic field...
Last time we did that, almost half the colony got obliterated.
If we don't get it back online as fast as possible we are doomed!
*As you and Izumi get to the Spaceship there is a loud hissing*
*Everyone looks up*

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
I hope you regret this in hell.
*Spaceship takes off*
*You witness as a meteor strikes the solar panels systems to nothing*

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
*You get back to the Spaceship*
Izumi?! Are you there?
*Silence*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Commander do you copy?
*Izumi starts a countdown*

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
WAIT, WAIT, IM NOT READY.
*Magnetic field shuts off*
*You see Izumi running but Ivy manages to catch him and pin him to the ground*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Commander?! How could you... is this it? You get to go back?
And I get to rot here?
I also have a family on earth, I also have ambitions...
Come back... please...

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text:
You see... we're a small family, apart from me and Lilly, we have Ivy the mechanic who your friend might get to meet...
And the other 2 are just ahead.
I could've never even imagine to survive for so long without them, much less make the colony self-sustaining.
*You see 2 figures in the distance*
*A women and a small child are staring intently*

dialogs.speaker: Unknown
dialogs.text:
Hi... I'm Orchid, and this is Aster.
*Grabs Aster by the hand*

dialogs.speaker: Aster
dialogs.text: Dad, who are them?

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: We're astronauts from earth, we were sent on a mission to find out why the asteroids and debris are deviating into earth...

decisions.text: Enough, you shouldn't talk about the mission to non related people! The base could get you terminated. *Go see what Izumi is doing*
Unfortunately we got hit by debris and most of our Spaceship functions stopped working making us unable to return.

dialogs.speaker: Orchid
dialogs.text:
When we first came here, to start the colony, asteroids and debris also used to rain down non stop.
But with the help of Carnation and Ivy we managed to raise a magnetic field around this area...

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text:
The magnetic field not only helps in making this area more secure, it also serves as a energy reserve if we stop getting energy from the Sol.
If you look outside, there's an area that looks like it has a checkered floor. In reality its all solar panels to make it so we never have to worry about energy.
From the oxygen bubble to the machines in the mechanical bay, even the labs need the panels to keep everything in place.
In case of an emergency we should last about a week...

decisions.speaker: Player
decisions.text: I see you have thought of everything...

decisions.speaker: Player
decisions.text: Can the magnetic field be disabled?

dialogs.speaker: Aster
dialogs.text:
Dad is ready for anything!
Isn't that right?
*Chuckles*

dialogs.speaker: Orchid
dialogs.text: Aren't you a lively one?

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
You hear someone rushing in your direction*
*Izumi swiftly grabs Aster and puts a knife to his neck*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Commander... Why didn't you tell us? *The once censured Mission Protocol*
Contact Shadow Garden and disable the magnetic field [High Risk]

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
Never would've thought that we would find a ghost's nest...
Base seems to think this magnetic field, could be the cause to the deviation of the asteroids to Earth.

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text:
Please, let Aster go...
Your problem is with me!

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: On one condition, you disarm and surrender yourself to me.

decisions.text: Calm down, you don't need to do this... you will only get yourself killed.
*You see Celeste Moving* Do nothing

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
I have so much to do back home...
My family is waiting for me, if sacrificing people I hardly know, is what it takes to go back...
I won't hesitate, how can you guys choose to stay?

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
It's not about choice, they are humans too...
But you could never understand that.
Now unhand the child and stop freaking out!

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
I can't, don't you see?
I already started this, there's no way they would let me walk out unharmed.*You stare intently to the Captain*

decisions.text: *Let things unfold* Say nothing
Try mediating

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text:
*Izumi lunges at the captain and slashes his eye*
*Softly*
Thanks for not injuring Aster, and goodbye.
*Ivy who was trailing behind Izumi shoots him clear in the head*
*Izumi lifeless body thumps to the ground*

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: Goodbye friend...

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
I know you might be scared... even imagining not being able to go back to your family sounds scary.
But you still have me... and Celeste.
I'm sure they won't harm you if you just let Aster go.
I wouldn't let them.

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
Promise?
*Aster frees himself from Izumi's grip and runs towards Orchid*
*Ivy who was just behind Izumi, knocks him out and cuffs him*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
What do you think you are doing Celeste?
Do you dislike me that much!?

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: Shut your trap Izumi, I'm tired of your shenanigans. *Pulls a gun*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
*Screams*
You wouldn't...
*Celeste shoots Izumi in the legs*
*Izumi manages to stab her in the abdomen*

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
I'm sorry...
*Celeste shoots Izumi one last time*
*After 10 minutes Celeste also passes away from bleeding*

dialogs.speaker: Carnation
dialogs.text: It could, maybe for a couple minutes... anything more would destroy everything we've built.

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text: Have you ever tried to disable it?

dialogs.speaker: Orchid
dialogs.text:
Once... but never again.
*An alarm sounds*
*The captain rushes to the magnetic field console room*
*You and Celeste follow*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
I'm disabling the magnetic field whether you people like it or not, I have a mission to complete, I'm not getting stuck here...
I HAVE A GODDAMN LIFE UNLIKE YOU!

dialogs.speaker: Ivy
dialogs.text: Stop that, you can't disable it... it might get us killed.

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
Are you truly such a selfish bastard that you would risk killing all these people for the sake of a mission?
Would you stoop that low? Is the congratulatory pat in the back and promotion worth the sacrifice???

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: WHO CARES? You don't even know these people and what the hell do YOU know of sacrifice???

decisions.text:
Clearly more than you if you are willing to throw away all your morals for the sake of a paycheck...
It's not an option, I'm your Commander and I'm telling you, YOU can go home but the mission is OVER!

Let's all calm down, Izumi, you can leave, we can deactivate the field for about 2 to 5 minutes...
Enough for take off, we'll provide food and whatever else you need...but it's over, give up before we make you...

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: And what will happen to you two?

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
We are staying, we see a future here, if your glory obsessed excuse of an existence doesn't feel free to leave.
You have about 2 to 5 minutes to leave.
This will deactivate de magnetic field... go!

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
2 to 5 minutes you say? Okay... It has been a displeasure to work with you...
*Izumi embarks and leaves*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text: And what could you possibly do to stop me? I hold all the cards you see...

decisions.text: You see Celeste moving *Do nothing*
Not all the cards...You are forgetting one crucial thing.

dialogs.speaker: Celeste
dialogs.text:
*Pulls out a gun* Go... I'm warning you I will shoot.
Leave and never come back, tell base we both died.
*Izumi embarks and leaves*

dialogs.speaker: Izumi
dialogs.text:
What thing?
This is all calculated, nothing you could do can stop me.

dialogs.speaker: Player
dialogs.text:
Even if you could deactivate it, we would never let you leave alive.
Go...
*Izumi embarks and leaves*
